data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in US Antitrust Case
data.Description: A US federal judge ruled that Google is a monopoly and has acted as one to maintain its dominance in the search market. The ruling could have significant implications for Google's business practices, including potential limitations or a breakup of the company.

data.Title: Apple Refuses to Replace Google with Bing as Default Search Engine
data.Description: Despite Microsoft's alleged offer to provide Bing for free, Apple remains steadfast in its partnership with Google as the default search engine for Safari.  Apple attributes its decision to Bing's inferior search quality and potential revenue loss.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces New Recommendations Feature
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new feature that provides personalized SEO recommendations to website owners. The recommendations are based on data from Search Console and aim to help improve website performance in Google Search results.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns in the coming months. Google claims that Performance Max offers all the benefits of Smart Campaigns and more.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Shows Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report has removed the "call" tab, which provided statistics and data on calls originating from Google Search and Google Maps. This change is suspected to be related to the recent removal of Google Business Profile call history.

data.Title: Apple Maintains a Search Index of Billions of Websites
data.Description: Documents revealed during the DOJ's antitrust case against Google disclose that Apple maintains its own search index, encompassing billions of websites. The exact number remains redacted, but the revelation highlights Apple's potential to compete in the search market.
